alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 3:19AM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts over mountain peaks and the Kaibab Plateau above 8000 feet. The most hazardous travel conditions are likely Friday afternoon and evening. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 6000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Prescott, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...From 5 PM this afternoon to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute and any New Year`s Eve travel plans. Snow forecast from 5 PM Today to 5 AM Saturday: Doney Park 1 to 3 inches Flagstaff 4 to 8 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches Jacob Lake 4 to 8 inches North Rim 6 to 10 inches Prescott 0 to 1 inches Valle 1 to 3 inches Williams 4 to 6 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains
